reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After spending the entire day with friends at a nearby amusement park. I was looking forward to checking in. This place is divide into two sections. A motel area, with outside access to the rooms. And a hotel area, inside access to the rooms. My room was in the hotel section. Checking in was fast and simple. Was given directions to my room and off I went. Drove around to rear parking lot. Unloaded our luggage and headed to the door. First thing I noticed was a lack of security. At most hotel/motels nowadays. You need your room key to enter a side entrance to the building. Not at this place! Anybody off the street could waltz right in. That gave me an uneasy feeling even before I saw my room. Making our way down the hall to our room. The doors to all the rooms were very narrow. Looked like the door you would see on a closet. If you're a big person and have a nice size piece of luggage. No way your going through these entrance ways without a problem! Upon entering the room I smelled the unmistakeable odor of paint. It was strong and bothersome. I immediately turned the air conditioner on and opened the sliding patio door. Hoping it would help dissipate the odor. It didn't. After being in the room for approximately 30 minutes. I decided to call the front desk to see about getting another room. Told her the problem and before i could even finish. Was told they were all booked up, sorry. She said she would have maintenance come up and spray odor neutralizer in our room. Well I thought that was better than nothing. So we left the room to meet our friends for dinner. Hoping when we returned the foul stench was gone. Returned from dinner to find nothing different. Odor still strong as ever.
reviews.title: THIS IS NOT A RESORT OF ANY KIND...

reviews.text: As for the room it self. Nothing special at all. Bathroom vanity and sink were new. Toilet also. Toilet was set unusually far from the wall behind it. Making it jut out. Sink was very shallow and had a flat bottom. Like most men out there. You need to fill the sink with hot water to shave and rinse the razor properly. Not with this sink. Only 2 inches deep if that! And the final kicker about this not so nice place was the remote control. Was a generic cheapo model they didn't take the time to program to the television in the room. Which was equally as cheap. Bottom line, this place cut corners left and right. The paint odor I attribute to the use of a very poor quality paint. Was told by the front desk. The room was painted a month ago.
reviews.title: Tried it and wont be returning....

reviews.text: First of all - I had wanted to try this hotel for awhile ( we vacation in LG very often ) but never had been. So, I was on my company website and saw that they had an offer for Howard Johnson so I made the reservation. Then I googled this hotel and saw all the comments on this and other forums and tried to cancel the reservation ( 2 hours after I made it and 3 days prior to my arrival ) and they refused.
reviews.title: Never again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So, I decided to make the best of it and go anyhow. My first impression is that this is more of a motel - I don't know where they are getting the "resort" from on the sign but this is certainly not a resort.
reviews.title: Lake George Anniversary Getaway
Stay at "The Tiki"!
reviews.text: The indoor pool ( as indicated by others on here ) is more of a hot tub and accomodates one family. If that. So, we went to the outdoor pool - there was a kiddie pool there that was filthy and uncleaned so we went in the larger pool which FYI is not heated so that was chilly. But, it appeared to be clean. THere was another party there that was jumping in the water fully clothed despite the sign indicating to wear bathing attire but I suppose the hotel can't be accountable for guest that don't abide by all the rules.

Traveling with my elderly mom and my 14 year old niece and nine year old nephew, I just returned from a three night stay (7/26-29) at the Howard Johnson's Tiki Resort. I called Howard Johnson's on Saturday (7/24) and told the representative that I wanted to use the "Room Saver" coupon and was wondering how availability looked for the week of 7/25. I was told there were 18 rooms available and I would get a room with two double beds for the coupon rate of $89.00. Upon arrival on 7/26, I was told by the desk clerk that there were no rooms available at the $89.00 rate, but I could get a room for $119.00. When I asked if I could use my AARP discount, I was told that I could, so that brought the rate down to $113.00, and I was also offered immediate early check-in which was very much welcomed after the four hour drive, so we decided to stay here. We were not disappointed except for one problem. When I opened the hotel room door, my nephew screamed out, "this room stinks!" After a few hours I realized the room smelled like it was recently painted, but there is painting going on now on the hotel exterior and it was very hot, but no matter why the paint smell is in the room, it was not pleasant, and it was worse for me because I have an inhalant allergy and get headaches from the smell of paint. I noticed when the air conditioner was running, the smell wasn't so noticeable, but when it automatically turned off during it's cycle, the paint smell was very noticeable again. A nice breeze was blowing during part of our stay so I would open the sliding door to try and get some fresh air in the room, but it didn't help much.
reviews.title: Very nice stay except for a few glitches......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Besides the paint problem, our stay was wonderful, we all enjoyed the good sized outdoor pool, the water temperature was cool enough to be refreshing, but not too cold, and the picnic tables on the property came in handy, we ate on them several times, and there was a small view of the lake from the picnic tables and our room, unfortunately much of the view is blocked by trees. The restaurant has a great breakfast at a reasonable price. The hotel staff was very nice, helpful and friendly, the maid even offered me help to carry my luggage to the room, I refused help very thankfully, but I was very impressed by her kind gesture! The room came with a nice size fridge, it was about three feet high, not a real tiny mini-fridge that most hotels have, and it held all of our food items handily, even big juice bottles. The bathroom is very small, but the bath water was very hot, and it suited our needs.
reviews.title: Nice, Convenient - Not a Resort.

reviews.text: The glass doors leading to the hotel rooms in the back don't have secure entry, my 14 year old niece noticed it right away and it bothered her, so it seems to me that when even a young teenager is cognizant of the fact that a hotel property doesn't have proper security, this is something that needs fixing and management should take care of it as soon as possible.
reviews.title: IMAGINE - A HORRIBLE HOTEL AND I NEVER EVEN GOT THERE

reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location, all the sightseeing boats, lake front miniature golf, shops, beach, etc. are a very short drive or 10 to 15 minute walk away from the hotel, with some free parking available. Restaurants, a convenience store, and a wonderful water park are a very short distance from the hotel.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, dated property, clean, conveniently located

reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again, but only if the room didn't smell like paint, I never looked forward to returning to the room, and it makes you wonder why a hotel wouldn't use odor free paint rather than lose business.
reviews.title: Fun Motel with Friendly Staff and authentic vintage tiki decor- great for large groups!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tiki resort- Howard Johnson is basically a regular motel despite the "resort" in its name. There was nothing exceptional about the place you get what you pay for-which is a semi decent room that could use lots of touch up in furnishing. There is a damp smell to the room so you need to keep the AC on. Everything looks old if you stare long enough. Customer service was okay- again nothing exceptional. If you are doing a short weekend getaway and just need a place to sleep then this place will be okay. If you are expecting anything remotely extravagant then I suggest you go elsewhere. The outdoor pool was nice, a bit cold a first but you get adjusted to it. There were a lot of people enjoying their time by the pool. The indoor pool was very small and not that clean. Close to the major lake george village so that was nice. For the price, I would expect breakfeast to be included but it wasnt. But again, its practical for a place to sleep.
reviews.title: Very average

reviews.text: the place is a dump. it has that heavy dank smell that cheap hotels have. the paper thin towels were meant to discourage theft. the unheated outdoor pool was unreasonably cold. Not worth the price. I will say the restaurant was good for breakfast.
reviews.title: place is a dump, but good restaurant for breakfast
Very nice clean hotel, slightly overpriced
reviews.text: I realize we were staying in a very touristy area in the middle of the summer, but for over $150 a night I was hoping the rooms would slightly more special. They were very clean, but the overall look of our room facing the parking lot was one you would expect from a typcial motor lodge, there was zero Tiki anything. Other than that I would highly reccomend this hotel, the outside is very pretty, with cool Tiki statues and a nice reasonably priced cafe next to the lobby. All but one staff member was very pleasant, so all in all its a nice place to stay in the Lake George area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at this hotel on previous occasions. This review covers an eighteen days stay. It should tell you how much we enjoy it. Located within walking distance to the Village, this hotel offers proximity to the attractions while presenting a quiet environment. The staff is very friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean and nicely appointed. The pool water is a little cold, but it is crystal clear. Pool towels are provided and there are enough chairs to accomodate the clientele. There are also picnic tables with parasols on the pool deck. Parking is well located and plentiful. To sum up, this hotel offers everything needed to make our stays enjoyable and carefree.
reviews.title: Our favorite hotel in Lake George

reviews.text: We went there for the July 4th weekend with kids aged 5.5 yrs and 1.5 yrs. Excellent hotel - allowed us to check-in at noon, despite stated policy of 4pm. Very friendly front desk.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Our family stayed at the TIKI during a weekend trip Oct 10.
reviews.title: Nice Clean Hotel with Excellent Front Desk staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in Lake George to see the fall colors and we made last minute reservations. This hotel was a really nice place, we have never stayed at a Howard Johnson before (we usually stay at Westin, Sheraton, Hilton etc..) the staff at the supposedly luxury chains could learn a thing or to from the staff at the TIKI.
reviews.title: The very worst

reviews.text: The front desk staff was incredible, friendly, nice and very helpful.
reviews.title: Tiki HoJo is SoSo

reviews.text: The hotel itself was extremely clean and well maintained.
reviews.title: would stay again !

reviews.text: My son forgot his blankey at the hotel and when we called 6 hours after checkout (we were on our way home), they found the blanket and overnighted it to us at their own expense!
reviews.title: Good for the price
